subject: Re: [junit] Re: Missing API: Assert.assertThat(boolean) or 	IsCollection.isEmpty()
msgSnippet: ... How about assertReturned(0).from(list).size(); A little yoda-esque, but much shorter.  And I ve already implemented that one once. David Saff
messageBody:
On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 6:50 PM, Nat Pryce <nat.pryce@...> wrote:
> 2009/5/19 David Saff <david@...>:
>> I see the single-arg assertThat as sugar on top of exactly that
>> implementation, so the following would be equivalent:
>>
>> assertThat(list).isEmpty();
>> assertThat(list, theAforementioned(List.class).isEmpty());
>>
>> Yes, some serious work needs to be done on naming on the second line,
>> but hopefully the idea is clear.
>
> Definitely. I was thinking of something along those lines.
>
> As for objects that return a non-boolean result, there could (maybe,
> not sure how) be a three-parameter version like:
>
> assertThat(list, theAforementioned(List.class).size()).is(equalTo(0)));

How about

assertReturned(0).from(list).size();

A little yoda-esque, but much shorter. And I've already implemented
that one once.

David Saff
